intro: Rhynchocorys elephas subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-surfaced rhynchocorys, is a lesser-known plant species with distinctive botanical features. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some poisonous plants. The subspecies is characterized by its smooth, glabrous surface and compact growth habit. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
